messages.title: £700 back in your pocket
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats are offering you £700 tax cut to support you and your household.

messages.title: Decision Time Election 2010
messages.content: Your choice: Will it be a Labour MP or a Lib Dem MP? We can't win here Con 741, Lab 1478, Grn 204, Lib Dem 7041.

messages.title: Nick Clegg Sweeps the Nation
messages.content: On 15 Apr, the three party leaders presented their case to the nation in the first-ever televised leaders' debate.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Proposing £700 tax cut to support voters and their households.

mentions.candidate: Keith will fight for everyone in Hackney North and Stoke Newington.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: The leaflet references Labour and Conservative candidates indirectly in the context of local voting patterns.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Historical voting patterns are discussed, emphasizing that only the Liberal Democrats can win against Labour in this constituency.

issues.economy: The promise of a £700 tax cut could be related to economic policy.
issues.governance: Mentions the desire for a fairer system in governance and the need for open democracy.

housing.content: An open letter on the reverse highlights the housing issues.

leaflet.personalStatement: Keith has lived in Hackney and Stoke Newington for 17 years and loves living amongst such a vibrant community. He cares deeply about locals and pledges to fight on behalf of the community.

politicalExperience.achievements: Active in community affairs and events.

quotes.text: I will give straight answers to the issues confronting local people.

images.caption: Keith Angus with supporters holding 'I agree with Nick' posters.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet contains a bar graph showing the Liberal Democrats ahead of the Labour Party in local polling data.
